headline.main: OUR EUROPEAN MAILS.; The London Times on the President's Message. PROGRESS OF THE WAR. DANISH SOUND DUTIES. THE FOREIGN ENLISTMENT BILLL. A Ghost Speaketh to Lord Aberdeen.

docs.lead_paragraph: Government had a hard escape, though, in the opinion of many persons, it would have felt quite glad to fall unprotected by the "foreign mercenaries." At "a small party" of some 80 or 100 persons, at Mrs. MILNER GIBSON'S, last Sunday evening, the resignation of Lord ABERDEEN was thought to be almost out of doubt. headline.main: STATE AFFAIRS.; CHEAP COAL. Appointment of the Temperance Committee. THE CLAIMS OF OUR VETERANS. Report of the Superintendent of Public Instruction.. CASUALTIES AT FIRES. NEW-YORK CITY CHARTER AMENDMENTS.

NEW-YORK CITY.; English Policy in America--Lecture by Dr. McElberan. Chamber of Commerce. The Case of the Schooner Geo. H. Townsend. The New-York Sketch Club. New-York Geographical Society. New-York Eistorical Society. Mercantile Library Association. Mr. Leggett and the Empire City Bank. Launch. The Consolidated Stage Company in Court. Another Attempt to Murder. The Mayor to the Police Captains. Conclusion of the Investigation--Mr. Keen Honorably Exenerated.

docs.lead_paragraph: A lecture on "English Policy and the Anglo-Orange and Black Garrison in America " was delivered last Wednesday evening, in the Stuyvesant Institute, by Dr. McELHERAN. The audience was excessively large, and exhibited its approbation of the lecturer's sentiments by repeated bursts of Celtic enthusiasm.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; The New Common Council--Important Movements. Touching New Brooms. Action in Regard to Emigrants. The Trinity-street Murder. Whig General Committee for 1855. Fire in Water-street. The Schufeldt Case. Sunday Liquor-Selling--Decision. Weather The Harbor

docs.lead_paragraph: The session of the two Boards of the Common Council last evening were quite important, though chiefly preparatory. The Aldennen resolved to meet on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays. The Comptroller was directed to report at the next meeting of the Board the amount of money paid to the newspapers for Corporation Advertising and also to state whether the amount collected from property owners has paid the expense of advertising new improvements.

docs.lead_paragraph: TO THE SENATE AND ASSEMBLY: FELLOW-CITIZENS: In obedience to the requirements of the Constitution, I hereby submit for your consideration an account of the financial condition of the State, its various institutions and interests, together with such remarks as they suggest, as seem to me appropriate.

headline.main: THE NEW ADMINISTRATION.; The Common Council and the City and County Officers Sworn In. INAUGURATION OF THE MAYOR.

docs.lead_paragraph: organization of the two Boards of the Com. mon Council. A large number of citizens were in attendance at the City Hall on Monday in the hopesto witness the Inauguration of the newly elected Mayor, and to be present when the two branches of the City Legisla. ture assumed their respective seats.

headline.main: THE WEST INDIES.; The State Prisoners-Havana Politics. LATER PROM CUBA. The U.S. Sloop-of-war Albany Safe on the of October. ARRIVAL OF THE BLACK WARRIOR.

docs.lead_paragraph: The IT. S. Mail steamshipRBlack Warrior, J. D. BULLOCK, Commander, arrived on Tuesday from New-Orleans via Havana. There was nothing of interest stirring at the latter place. One of the passengers by the Black Warrior reports having left La Gunyra on the 8th of October; the sloopof-war Albany was then in port,-ofliccrs and crew all well. He thinks she was going down the coast.

docs.lead_paragraph: Before Judge Betts. The following persons, who have been convicted or have pleaded guilty to various indictments, were this morning brought up for sentence: RICHARD TEMMING, who pleaded guilty to an indictment for larceny on the high seas, in stealing a watch while on board the steamship Hermann, was sentenced to be imprisoned for 60 days.
